page.title: 06COLLEGES IN CHELTENHAM
page.content: The college of St.Mary's began in the centre of Cheltenham.It then moved to a building in St.George's Place called St.Mary's Hall(now called Shaftesbury Hall).In 1931 it bought the area called the Park,which was going to be a zoological garden with a lake and a wide walk for the elephants.Originally the college was for training teachers but after it merged with St.Paul's college in 1979. It provides many other courses.Our school has a long association with the trainee teachers.We also go up to the college for physical education.This is always good fun.We get there by bus up to the gates,then we walk up past the hall over some ramps and under a bridge building,past the gymnasia out onto the elephant walk and onto the field where we play all kinds of running games and ball games.
